question: Why is a shell necessary?

terminology.definition: a user interface; allows the user to interact with the [kernel] system
terminology.source: Learn Linux Shell Scripting Fundamentals of Bash 4.4

answer: a system that does not offer interaction would be hard to justify, not too mention hard to use

comment.what: an example of interaction is, giving the command to delete a file (either with a CLI or GUI) which removes the bytes from the disk
comment.who: Learn Linux Shell Scripting Fundamentals of Bash 4.4

comment.what: it can be seen as a shell around the kernel, meaning that it can be either a CLI or a GUI
comment.who: Learn Linux Shell Scripting Fundamentals of Bash 4.4
